thread.title: Jeremy 'Hot Mugshot Guy' Meeks Makes New York Fashion Week Debut
thread.title_full: Jeremy 'Hot Mugshot Guy' Meeks Makes New York Fashion Week Debut | Complex

author: Trace William Cowen
title: Jeremy 'Hot Mugshot Guy' Meeks Makes New York Fashion Week Debut

organizations.name: meeks makes new york fashion week debut jeremy 'hot mugshot guy' meeks makes new york fashion

text:
Jeremy 'Hot Mugshot Guy' Meeks Makes New York Fashion Week Debut By Trace William Cowen happy to waste more of your time here: @tracecowen 
  Image via @CarineRoitfeld Jeremy Meeks , once known as the "hot mugshot guy," made his New York Fashion Week debut Monday. Meeks walked in the Philipp Plein show Monday night rocking black-on-black awesomeness, the New York Daily News reported . Dude's debut was a high-profile affair witnessed by Kylie Jenner, Tyga, Paris Hilton, Fat Joe , Madonna, and more.
  @jmeeksofficial #LetsMakeNYFWgreatAgain - #NeighborHoodKingsNEWYORK 
A post shared by Philipp Plein (@philippplein78) on Feb 14, 2017 at 6:37am PST
Related “Hot Mugshot Guy” and 5 Other Sexy Prisoners Whose Mugshots Have Gone Viral Jeremy "Hot Mugshot Guy" Meeks Has Been Released From Prison “Hot Mugshot Guy” Jeremy Meeks Shares First Modeling Head Shot Meeks walked in Monday's show alongside Young Thug, Desiigner , and Pete Wentz. In an interview with the New York Times , Plein—a German designer—explained his hesitance in expanding to the United States. "I tried to avoid it for a very long time because the American market is very developed and the consumer is very spoiled," Plein said. "Markets like Russia and China are much more open to new brands and much easier to enter. They're hungry to consume."
  @petewentz #LetsMakeNYFWgreatAgain - #NeighborHoodKingsNEWYORK 
A post shared by Philipp Plein (@philippplein78) on Feb 14, 2017 at 6:54am PST
  @madonna @kyliejenner @kinggoldchains sitting first row at my first Show in NEW YORK !!!! Lit __ 
A post shared by Philipp Plein (@philippplein78) on Feb 13, 2017 at 11:47pm PST
After being sentenced to two years in federal prison on a weapons violation, Meeks was released in March 2016 to immediate modeling offers. His manager, Jim Jordan, said in a statement to the Los Angeles Times that Meeks appreciated the support and looked forward to his new career. "There are a multitude of offers on the table," Jordan said at the time. "Jeremy is humbled and grateful and overwhelmed by the outpouring of love, support, and prayers for him and his family."
Since first going viral in 2014 thanks to a Stockton Police Department Facebook post , Meeks has been chronicling his journey on social media. His verified Instagram account, with just 61 posts, currently boasts more than 765,000 followers:
  Thanks for all the love #Blessed 
A post shared by JEREMY MEEKS (@jmeeksofficial) on Jan 5, 2017 at 1:55pm PST
Tags: News , Fashion , New York Fashion Week , NYFW , mugshots
